properties.name: At least 2 Ebola confirmed cases - samples from Western Area (Freetown).
properties.description:
July 13 2014 - MOHS

Fourteen (14) of the 36 samples were Laboratory confirmed positive for Ebola. 8 from Kailahun, 3from Kenema;1 from Bo;1from Port Loko and **1from Western Area**

July 11 2014 - MOHS

On confirmed case from Western area

https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=317611755082340&id=281064805403702

properties.name: At least one confirmed case in Bonthe District

properties.description:
July 20 2014 - MOHS

An other confirmed case in Bo district.

https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=321668521343330&id=281064805403702

 July 14 2014 - MOHS

An other confirmed case from Bo

https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=318782864965229&id=281064805403702

 July 10 2014 

As a matter of fighting the Ebola outbreak in Sierra Leone or more so stopping its transfer to Bo, the District Medical Officer has proposed the stopping of the killing and sales of “bush meat” in the city of Bo. The DMO, Dr Alhaji S Turay also proposed the putting up of check points at some strategic entrance locations in the Bo City. The Paramount Chief Prince Lappia Boima accepted the first proposal of “not selling bush meat” in the city but held reservation towards the second proposal of check pointsTherefore, a Task Force has been set up in the city for monitoring the importation animals like “monkeys, baboons, bush cows,” from which bush meats could be attained. As at present, the Market Sellers Association has accepted the proposal too and is also helping with the monitoring of the sales of bush meat in both the markets and outside the market.
http://news.sl/drwebsite/publish/article_200525752.shtml

 July 10 2014 - MOHS

"...sample have been confirmed positive for Ebola ... from Bo"

https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=317202108456638&id=281064805403702

 July 10 2014 - United Methodist health center

"I am afraid that we are very likely to have more cases here in the Bo area following this development,” Saffa said, "because once one is in regular contact with an Ebola patient for over one week, there is a high tendency that one would catch the disease."

http://www.umc.org/news-and-media/ebola-outbreak-closes-united-methodist-health-center
